sub_title: MSc student of animal sciences, nutrition and metabolism.
summary:
MSc student majoring in animal sciences, nutrition, and metabolism. The specialization is the dairy sector. My vision is to become an advisor in the international animal husbandry sector (ruminants). My mission is to support farmers and to contribute toward a more sustainable World.
The short-term goal is to finalize my MSc degree (2022-2024) and get a relevant PhD project. The long-term goals are to realize myself as a specialist, to further develop my Dutch language, and to finalize my naturalization in the Netherlands (2 out of 7 integration tests are left).
As the end goal, after gaining more experience, knowledge, and resources, I am planning to establish my own advisory business, as well as to pass the knowledge/skills to the next generation of specialists. I do believe that such an approach will allow to preserve knowledge and multiply it, and thus the mission will be continued more efficiently and on a greater scale in the future.

projects.title: Successfull Land Use (to nutrition) consultancy project for  Melkveebedrijf De Elzenhof.
projects.description:
Successful project for Melkveebedrijf De Elzenhof, Velp. Personal project.
The project consisted of the analysis of current land use/forage production situation and further allocation of potential forage production/land use-related issues within the company, based on the interview with the owner of the company/client and analyses of relevant company-related documents, such as soil properties, forage properties, annual nutrition cycle analyses, etc. Additionally, the field assessment was performed. 
Such key performance indicators as land fertilization rate, manure output, annual herd’ forge demand per hectare of land based on the current ration, and milk herd performance upon current ration were analyzed. 
The information was analyzed and interpreted via desk research, interviews with relevant specialists and personal experience.  
Based on the gained information and allocated land use-related issues, the alternative strategy of land use was developed. Alternative strategy efficiency was analyzed via estimations of new forage quantity and quality, new ration balance, and potential performance of the milking herd upon that ration. Finally, all potential costs of alternative land use/changes were calculated. 
Final score: 9.0

projects.title: Innovation group project "COW-LED" for HansKamp company
projects.description:
The main goal of this group project was to analyze the potential of innovation as a base for a business
and attract prospective investors. Commissioner - Hans Kamp company. The so-called COW-LED collar idea, as an innovation, was created for efficient identification/searching of attention farm animals, primarily for dairy and beef cattle
The report was created in a form of a business plan and was segmented into market research, technical feasibility, and marketing mix. One of the most important elements of the research was the creation and distribution of an international survey in order to collect qualitative and quantitative information on the innovative concept from potential customers/farmers and relevant specialists (46 participants, 8 countries).  Personal role - chairman, primary contact person between the group and the commissioner, researcher, author of the innovative business idea "COW-LED".
Final score 7.2

contributors.headline: MSc student of animal sciences, nutrition and metabolism.

profile_positions.description:
For my MSc research, I am investigating the digestion and metabolism dynamics of Calcium (Ca), Phosphorus (P), and Magnesium (Mg) in different physiological stages of dairy cattle. The data collected during the core study will be analysed, and a draft manuscript (in the style of the Journal of Dairy Science) will be prepared.
Additionally, I will be conducting a comprehensive literature review that summarizes the homeostasis of Ca, P, and Mg in ruminants. The review will also evaluate current 2021 NASEM feeding recommendations for Ca, P, and Mg in Dairy Cattle.
Apart from the research, I will also provide assistance with ongoing trials.
profile_positions.title: Msc Thesis

profile_positions.description:
Creation of alternative manure management system concept (AEMS) as a response for nitrogen crisis in the Netherlands. Promotion and further development of the concept for it's further integration into the sector. Search and connection of relevant business owners from primary secondary and tertiary sectors, as well as other relevant parties to set up the trial, collect the data and ultimately to integrate the solution into the sector!
The specialists involved directly so far:  Mr. Arie Breukink, Prof Dr. Johan Sanders,  Prof Dr. Han Lindeboom.
profile_positions.title: Research, innovation development and promotion
